definition: lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
to be greedy in getting money
